title: We Are A Family-part 16
body:
Title: We Are A Family.
Pairings: Steve x tony, Peter x Wade, Nat x Clint, Sam x Bucky.
Part: 16/?
Warnings: swearing, fluff, angst, eventual smut, slowburn.
Summary: When Nat comes into the avengers tower with baby Peter Parker, the avengers didn’t know what they were getting themselves into. But now that Peter is here,Steve and Tony both feel protective over him. It doesn’t help that Peter hates everyone other than Steve and tony. But as Steve and tony raise Peter, they start to fall for one another. Will this superfamily work out or will it all turn to hell?
A/N: My exams are officially over! i had my last exam today, so i put this together for you all. Not working on this for the past couple of weeks was driving me insane cause i actually really love this fic and it’s like 34k overall which is CRAZY to me. Anyway thanks for your patience and i hope you enjoy!

Part 1, Part 2, Part 3, Part 4, Part 5, Part 6, Part 7, Part 8, Part 9, Part 10, Part 11, Part 12, Part 13, Part 14, Part 15

You told me that you loved me. Steve tried to remember it, his heart pounded in his chest. He didn’t know what to say. 
“Tony.” His voice barely came out as a whisper. 
“Oh. You know what, forget it. It’s not important, we don’t have to talk about it and-” Steve cut him off. 
“Tony.” Steve repeated and Tony sighed. 
“Yeah cap?” Steve couldn’t contain his smile. 
“You are impossible and difficult and I hate it when you go three days without sleep. You once yelled at me for making your coffee wrong and you are one of the most irrational people I know. But you are good and loving and I wouldn’t want anyone else to be Peter’s father. You’re one of the best men I know and I know I’ve made a lot of mistakes in my life, but telling you I love you in the hospital wasn’t one of them. I love you Tony.” And it was like a massive weight fell off of Steve’s shoulders. He watched Tony’s eyes widened and Steve’s heart pounded in his chest. He’d said it. It was out there in the world. 
“Steve-”
“You don’t have to say it back Tony. I know I said we’d take this slow but I am in love with you and it’s okay if you’re not in love with me.” Steve told him gently.

Tony was speechless. He was loved. Someone else on this damn planet loved him and of all people, it was Steve. Steven Grant Rogers had fallen in love with Anthony Edward Stark and that in itself was a fucking miracle. Steve had chosen Tony and had fallen in love with him and wants to raise Peter with him.
“Sometimes I want to punch you in your perfect teeth Rogers. But these past couple months with you and Peter have been the best of my life and I guess somewhere along the way I fell in love with you too.” Tony confessed and Steve’s eyes widened.
“Really?” he asked and Tony rolled his eyes.
“You’re going to drive me insane Rogers.” Tony muttered and crossed the distance to Steve, crashing his lips against Steve’s. Steve responded instantly and gripped the side of Tony’s face. Steve’s hands moved and pulled Tony into his lap, and Tony kissed Steve’s lips furiously, taking and taking and taking. Steve was his, that was just the way it was. He and Steve belonged together. Steve finally pulled back and leaned his forehead against Tony’s.
“Easy, easy.” He breathed and Tony smirked.
“Easy has never been my style Steve.” He murmured and kissed Steve’s neck, claiming him as his own. Steve moaned and just hearing that sound sent shivers through Tony’s body. Steve’s hands slid down to Tony’s ass and Tony rocked into Steve, causing the blonde to moan even louder this time.
“Are you sure Steve?” Tony asked and Steve nodded.
“Absolutely positive.” And then Steve brought his lips against Tony’s, kissing him and Tony couldn’t help but smile against his lips. Tony rocked his hips again and he was relieved Peter was with May. 
“Tony.” Steve groaned and Tony smirked. He loved knowing he had this effect on Steve.
“Yeah Cap?” Tony asked and something darkened in Steve’s eyes. He crashed his lips against Tony’s and Tony’s fingers entangled themselves in Steve’s hair. Soon Steve was lifting Tony up and carrying him towards Steve’s bedroom.

Steve and Tony were simply gazing into one another’s eyes in blissful silence. The sun was rising and everything had turned into a golden haze as the light filtered in through the window. 
“So now what?” Steve asked, his voice rough. Steve had decided to finally break the silence. Tony looked away and that simple act alone was enough to make Steve wish he’d never said anything.
“Now we should probably get up and get ready for the day. I’ve got a meeting with Fury and Bruce wants to check up on you.” Tony said, rolling over and getting out of Steve’s bed. Steve watched him, a slight frown on his face and then Tony left his room. With a sigh, Steve rolled onto his back and stared up at the ceiling. Great. After declaring their love for one another and for what came after that, Steve was supposed to get a check up from Bruce and Tony was going to have a meeting with Fury. Like any other, boring, normal and completely-average day. Great.

Tony knew exactly what Steve had been asking in bed this morning. But he wasn’t ready to have that discussion. He and Steve were practically together already, and the night before had only solidified that. But to officially say it out loud felt different somehow. It felt more vulnerable and a part of Tony was terrified that Steve was only seconds from turning around and declaring that the night before had been a huge mistake. So like always, he ran. Not far, only into the next room. But he’d still gotten out of there as quickly as possible. And now he was sitting in a cab, mere inches away from Steve. Neither of them said a word. Tony glanced at Peter who was sitting on Steve’s lap, looking back and forth between them both. The cab pulled up to the compound, Tony paid and they got out. Tony looked to Steve to find Steve was already watching him.
“What’s up Rogers?” Tony hated how much it sounded like he didn’t care. He knew this looked bad and he knew it was a defense mechanism. He didn’t want walls up when it came to Steve, but some old habits simply die hard.
“Are we going to go in there and pretend like last night didn’t happen?” Steve asked and Tony bit his lip.
“What do you want exactly Steve?” Tony asked, he didn’t want to say or do the wrong thing.
“You.” Steve smirked and Tony swallowed.
“oh.”
“I understand that this is messy and complicated and there are a million people out there who are going to think this is twisted and wrong and Maybe this doesn’t last. But it’s here now and I love you and you love me and that’s all that matters to me now. So I want you Tony.” It sent the warm and fuzzies through Tony’s body. He was wanted, he was loved, he had been chosen. And simply knowing that made Tony’s heart swell, so he crossed the space between them and crashed his lips against Steve’s.
“Why are you so perfect?” he asked as he pulled back, leaning his forehead against Steve’s.
“I love you.” Steve whispered and Tony grinned.
“I love you too.” Tony whispered and Steve grinned. Then hand in hand, they entered the avengers compound. Together.

It felt like Steve was in a dream, like none of this was real. It couldn’t possibly be real. This couldn’t be happening to him. But it was real, his life had fallen perfectly together. And it was all because of the little boy in his arms. 
“You are a miracle.” Steve told Peter as they entered Bruce’s lab. 
“How are you feeling?” Bruce asked and Steve felt like he was the luckiest person alive.
“Good.” He murmured and sat down. He sat through all the tests, watched as Bruce checked on Peter. But when Bruce investigated some of Steve’s broken ribs, he frowned.
“These have gotten worse.” He murmured and Steve’s heart rate sped up. Just a little.
“Been doing strenuous exercise Steve?” Nat said from the doorway. Steve couldn’t stop the blush, he simply looked down at his hands.
“A couple weeks rest won’t hurt Steve. You need to heal first.” Bruce told him and Steve nodded his head.
“Alright.”
“I’m going to get some coffee, want anything?” Bruce asked. Both Steve and Natasha shook their heads. The second Bruce was out the door, Natasha punched his arm.
“Ow!”
“Why didn’t you tell me about you and Tony?” she demanded and Steve rubbed the spot she had hit.
“How do you know?” he demanded.
“I figured it out at the hospital, why didn’t you tell me?” Steve squeezed his eyes shut and sighed.
“It was all so new, I guess we just sort of wanted to stay in our own little happy bubble before telling everyone.” Steve shrugged and Nat was scowling.
“But I’m not everyone.” She said in a small voice. 
“I was going to tell you first anyway.” Steve told her and she nodded her head. 
“You better have.” She told him and Steve grinned. 
“I told him I love him.” Nat’s eyes widened and Steve looked at Peter, at his son. 
“And what did Tony say?” She demanded and Steve couldn’t stop the grin. 
“He told me he loved me.” Even Nat smiled. 
“I’m happy for you two.” She told him and Steve nodded. 
“I don’t know what the future holds for us and for all we know Tony and I could break up tomorrow. But this feels good and it feels right and I can picture a future with Tony.” Steve explained and Nat nodded. 
“Good. You and Stark deserve to be happy.” She told you and he nodded. 
“Thanks Nat. You deserve to be happy too.” She rolled her eyes. 
“My standards are too high.” She told him dryly and Steve couldn’t help but raise an eyebrow. 
“Too high or is it simply that you’ve already found the person?” Steve asked and she glared at him. 
“We already have had this discussion Steve.” She said in a voice that made Steve rethink pursuing this conversation. 
“But you’d be happy with-” she squeezed her eyes shut. 
“He has a girlfriend.” She said at long last and Steve’s eyes widened. 
“Oh.”
“Yeah.”
“I’m so sorry-”
“It’s fine, Laura’s nice. She’s good for Clint.” But Steve could see the pain in Nat’s eyes. 
“You know I’m here if you ever want to talk about it.” She nodded. 
“Thanks Steve. And you shouldn’t be training when you’re injured.” Nat scolded and Steve smirked. 
“Who said I was training?” He asked and she groaned. 
“I didn’t need to know that.” And Steve couldn’t help but grin. Peter was his. Tony Stark was his. He had everything he could have ever wanted. 

Slowly Tony and Steve let the avengers know they were together. Most people had already accepted that idea months ago which had surprised Tony. But everyone had simply decided that they’d fall in love once they had adopted Peter. It was nice that they all approved, but Tony wouldn’t have cared even if they hadn’t approved. He loved Steve and Steve was his and that was all that mattered. A part of Tony kept waiting for him to wake up. To find out this was all a dream. He’d be on that awful couch and none of this would have happened. Maybe Steve chose Bucky. Maybe none of this was real. But each time Steve hugged him or kissed him or said he loved him, it hit Tony that this was his reality. And it was the best feeling in the whole damn world. 
“Steve…” Tony trailed off and Steve looked up at him. 
“Yeah?”
“You look ridiculous.” Steve broke out laughing. Tony had recently bought him an apron that said hot stuff. Tony meant is as a joke but now Steve wore it every time he cooked. 
“You should’ve thought it through when you bought it for me then.” Tony groaned. 
“Just come sit with me and Peter. We can order pizza!” Tony exclaimed and Steve chuckled. 
“If you had your way we would have pizza every night.” Tony shrugged. 
“I don’t see a downside of that.” Steve shook his head. 
“Play the movie, I’ll make dinner.” Steve told him and Tony sighed. Peter was playing with one of his toys, so Tony stood up and walked to the kitchen. 
“I feel bad.” He murmured and watched Steve chop up a carrot. 
“Go watch the movie Tony.” Instead Tony wrapped his arms around Steve’s waist, pressing his face into Steve’s back. 
“I can help with dinner.” He knew Steve was grinning, Tony was grinning himself. 
“You will be nothing but a distraction.” Steve told him gently. 
“A distraction? Do I distract you Steve?” Tony asked and Steve chuckled. 
“Go watch the movie Tony. I’ll be there soon.” With a heavy sigh Tony nodded. 
“Okay. But give me a kiss first.” So Steve turned in his arms and pressed his lips against Tony’s. 
“Now go watch the movie so I can make dinner.” Steve murmured and Tony nodded. 
“Alright Rogers.”

“Tony.” His voice barely came out as a whisper. 
“Oh. You know what, forget it. It’s not important, we don’t have to talk about it and-” Steve cut him off. 
“Tony.” Steve repeated and Tony sighed. 
“Yeah cap?” Steve couldn’t contain his smile. 
“You are impossible and difficult and I hate it when you go three days without sleep. You once yelled at me for making your coffee wrong and you are one of the most irrational people I know. “Steve-”
“You don’t have to say it back Tony. I know I said we’d take this slow but I am in love with you and it’s okay if you’re not in love with me.” Steve told him gently.

Steven Grant Rogers had fallen in love with Anthony Edward Stark and that in itself was a fucking miracle. Steve had chosen Tony and had fallen in love with him and wants to raise Peter with him.

“Really?” he asked and Tony rolled his eyes.
“You’re going to drive me insane Rogers.” Tony muttered and crossed the distance to Steve, crashing his lips against Steve’s. Steve responded instantly and gripped the side of Tony’s face. blog.title: Not Even 50% Of My TRUE Power
blog.description: Comics guy, writer guy, Superman guy

summary: I don't suppose you glanced at the oversized X-Men and Avengers issues?
question: I don't suppose you glanced at the oversized X-Men and Avengers issues?
answer:
Not X-Men, yes Avengers. Having reread the first arc it was better than I thought but still a little awkward, but with these last few issues it feels like the book’s finding its groove and becoming more recognizable as a sweet Jason Aaron big idea fight comic. And the first big reveal cracked me up, while the second I think actually left me lightly jaw agape - not exactly as shocking as that implies, but certainly fascinating in terms of the implications of where it could go.

At this point, lemme just say what I thought of everything I got this week besides this, Superman, and Cosmic Ghost Rider:

Hawkman: Impossibly still good, though Moz-Ga struck me as out of character, to the extent that that can apply. Though I suppose it is beyond our understanding, and it’s not like we saw much of it in Orlando’s JLA.

Wonder Woman: Didn’t bowl me away, but a great high concept and perfectly solid execution rooted more in setting up an interesting new arc than being a flat-out Bold New Direction, so I’ll see where this is going. Not liking Cary Nord here though.

The New World: Remains an interesting oddity, though the dual covers gimmick is very specifically not for me.

The Lone Ranger: So who else remembers Mark Russell just kicked off a Lone Ranger book? And a good one! It’s only two issues in as of day, totally hop onboard.

Captain America: So happy I gave Coates’ comics a second chance after the first year of Panther failed to grab me, this is some quality Captain America content. Though I can imagine certain fans are already hand-wringing about the central fight scene.

Exiles: This is still a fun good pretty book you all should be getting, and Wolvie is still the one truly unproblematic fave left in this terrible world!

Venom: No Cosmic Ghost Rider, but still some good Donny Cates.

The Unbeatable Squirrel Girl: Derek Charm has so subtly but profoundly shifted the entire tenor of the title, but in a way that 100% works, and this is still quietly an essentially perfect comic and probably the best non-Hulk book out of the House of Ideas.

Thor: This one’s as by-the-numbers as it gets, but that’s not a problem when it’s done as right as this does it.

Supergirl: Wasn’t certain if I’d grab it but Shaner lured me in after all, and this was a really fun, accessible issue; if my dad really enjoys it, I could see getting the 3 leading into it and what comes next. I’m shocked though at how much this really does seem to be a continuation of some of the most important plot threads from Man of Steel; I figured this would be to that as Red Robin was to Bruce Wayne ‘dying’, advertised as investigating big questions while in substance having nothing to do with it, but instead this really does appear to be tackling a lot of the big questions and moments I imagined would be reserved for Superman proper.

Electric Warriors: A fascinating thing, reading so similarly to Orlando’s creator owned work with Namesake or Crude and therefore engaging that mindset, and then the Extremely DC Comics Shit gets involved and forces you to spontaneously recalibrate. And remember when Travel Foreman was assigned to Ultimates2 and it seemed like that sort of major sci-fi superhero stuff was such a bizarre, poor fit that wouldn’t at all play into his talents? We know better now.

Mister Miracle: It was very, very good, and that’s about all I’m capable of saying until a reread of it and also the original Fourth World and even then probably stewing on it for awhile.

body:
In Defense of Aaron’s Avengers

As a longtime Avengers fan, trust me when I say that Jason Aaron’s current run is the best the main Avengers book has been since the Kurt Busiek run.


And yet, people keep bitching about it despite the A-List talent working on the book. Even though every seemingly big plot hole or character inconsistentcy has been explained;


She-Hulk becoming more savage than the end of her previous run? She absorbed a huge amount of Gamma Energy when she touched that Celestial in #2.


Robbie gaining a Penance Stare? Aaron proved in #700 that he knows what Robbie’s deal is and he’s making a story around this discrepancy.


Namor becoming evil again? It’s almost like the character is a notoriously violent dickhead. Stop the fucking presses.


But in the end, I don’t need to defend myself. No matter what anyone says, I’m still gonna buy every issue of this run because I’m having a ton of fun with it!


Avengers Assemble!
